item.title: Youthful Wisdom
item.description:
[caption id="attachment_1277" align="alignright" width="300" caption="gemsling on Flickr"][/caption]

“Maturity has more to do with what types of experiences you've had, and what you've learned from them, and less to do with how many birthdays you've celebrated.” - Anon

People often tell me that I am exceptionally mature for my age. Ignoring the truthfulness of this statement, I've always been curious what that means exactly. Generally, the implication is that adults are more mature than children, but even as a child, I knew several adults more emotionally unstable than I and who were far worse at taking care of themselves. That said, I also know a few youngsters who make me feel positively infantile. So how is it possible for a younger person to have more maturity than an older person?
